intro: Gonatanthus peltatus, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a tropical plant native to South America, characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically red or orange in color. Gonatanthus peltatus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and vibrant blooms.
